intro: Hymenolepis platyrhynchos var. glauca, commonly known as the blue-leafed hollyhock, is a variant of the hollyhock plant characterized by its distinctive blue-green foliage. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is native to regions of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually pink to red, with five petals, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for both garden use and traditional medicinal purposes.
